text: Welcome to twominuteenglish.com. Teaching you English through two-minute lessons.
In this lesson, we will learn how to break the ice and start a conversation.
Hey, how are you? I’m Jackson. It’s nice to meet you.
I’m Karen. Nice to meet you too.
I think you’re Jamie’s friend, right?
Yeah, Jamie invited me to the party. What about you?
Well, I’m Jamie’s classmate. I saw you once   with Jamie at a mall I think.
Actually, I’m Jamie’s cousin. I don’t live here but I visit him quite often.
So. Are you enjoying the party?
Yes, I’m having fun! What about you? Do you like parties?
I’m not much of a party-goer but this   one is nice. I like the music.
So do I. Should we join the people at the dance floor?
Sure, let’s go!
Hey, my name is Penny. I’m new to the class.
Oh, hi! I’m Suzanne
I wanted to ask you something.
Sure. What is it?
Actually I’m also new in town and I’m not sure   about my way back home. Can you help me?
No problem. Where do you live?
I live on George Street.
It’s not too far from the school and it’s on   my way.  We can go back together.
Oh! That would be great, thank you.
Hi, I’m looking for a particular novel. Can you help me out?
Sure. Which one is it?
Well, I want to buy Love Story by Erich Segal.
Oh, it’s really a great novel. I read it a long time ago.
And was it interesting? Did you like it?
A lot! I’ve read it many times.
I’ve been thinking about reading it for a long   time. Maybe it’s time to actually do it.
Here! You will love this novel!
Thank you so much for your help.
Hey, how are you? I’m Jackson. It’s nice to meet you.
I’m Karen. Nice to meet you too.
Are you enjoying the party?
What about you? Do you like parties?
Hey, my name is Penny. I’m new to the class.
Oh, hi! I’m Suzanne.
Hi, I’m looking for a particular novel.
Can you help me out?
